intro: Icicopsis tenuifolia var. multijuga, commonly known as the slender leaf icicopsis, is a rare and delicate plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
